answers.answer: If i have forgotten anything els on here just post it up :) i just wanted to know what was more common to happen

my waters didnt break at all with any of the births they broke them for me just before baby was born i went in as had painful contractions, ive heard approx 30% of women have their waters break and that leads them to the hospital so really its not that high, just trust your body you will know when to go in!

ah ok thats what i was curious about i wasnt sure what % of women have there waters break that leads them to the hospital, i dont think i like the thought of someone breaking my waters for me lolif u get into the hospital and ur waters havent broken do they sometimes wait for them to break naturally or if ur contractions are getting more regular do they just do that?

when i was pregnant with my son my water broke at 32 weeks and i went in.i didnt start to have contractions for a few more hours.with my daughter,i was 39 weeks and i had contractions first,went in and a couple hours later my water broke naturally.both times though they filled me back up with water.(or whatever it was that they used)

Lissyloo- in all  honesty if your waters haven't broken on their own your doctors should wait until the late stages of labor to break them when you are fully dilated etc.  That could avoid some serious complications.  But it doesn't always happen that way.
Once my waters broke with no contractions.  The other two times I was in active labor before I knew it but my waters had not broken.  They broke my waters at the hospital right before delivery.

I went in because I was having contractions every three minutes but they sent me home after monitoring me for a couple hours because I wasn't progressing. I went to my OB  the next day and my water broke in her office, she obviously told me to get the heck out of there and go to the hospital.

Dont be nervous about your water being broken, I happened to have two water bags so they had to break the second one for me, I just felt a little bit of pressure.Usually they wont let you go too long after your water breaking but in my case, I didn't give birth for 26 hours after my water broke, I just wasn't progressing, even with pitocin, in fact my contractions stopped while I was pushing.

With my last, I went in when my contractions were 1 min apart and my had not broken yet.  My babies come almost immediately after my water breaks so I can't wait.  You can usually judge by your contractions what stage of labor you are at.  I think for the most part.   I would also suggest that you don't let the doc break your water.  You'll have a much more comfortable (so to speak) labor if you have waters to cushion the pain.  Does that make sense.  My first labor I had the waters broke for me and I won't do that again!!!

thanks everyone for ur imput i like knowing how this stuff works because i only have a few more wks to go and still dont no what to expect i guess none of us do until it happends but u know what i mean lolfeel free to keep ur labour stories coming girls!

At 38 weeks I went into labor with my son and my contractions were 2-3 min apart. The 2 days before this I was having contractions 10-15 min. apart at first, then 5-10 min the next day, but they would stop at night. So I knew it wasn't the real thing then. Once they were 2-3 min, I went in and was already 6cm. My water never broke...My midwife broke it when I was 9cm to get me to that last cm. (My labor kinda stalled for 5 hours!!) It worked though! My mother had 4 children and her water never broke with any of us. They always broke it at the hospital. I try to labor as much as possible at home before heading to the birth center. I just feel more confortable in my own home.I wonder what this baby will be like! =)
Went in because of painful contractions. They had to break my water at the hospital.
I was almost 42 weeks with my first.  Contractions started and doc broke my water at the hospital about 12 hours in.
I was having contractions and then my water broke and I had the mother of all contractions so I went to the hospital right away. Baby was born about an hour later.

#1- I was induced, my waters were broken by the doc partway thru (completely painless, I might add).#2- went in because of contractions, again, water broke by doc#3- went in with contractions, water broke on its own almost the minute I got settled into my room. A pleasant surprise! = )  He came much more quickly than the first two.#4-???I plan to work (teach) up till 8 days before I am due, and I still live in fear that my water will break in front of my middle schoolers!!

My water has never broke on its own with any of my last 3 children.Went to the hospital when I felf the first good contraction (I tend to deliver fast) and the doctor broke my water somewhere between the last few cm.Breaking your bag of waters can get things going for you if your labor is stalled or if they are inducing so sometimes they do it earlier in labor. They take a crochey (sp) needle with a small hook on the end and snag the bag. It sounds worse than it really is though. I dont remember even feeling it, it was like an exam, I was just uncomfortable with that, lol:)

I went to the hospital when my contractions were 3 minutes apart, but my water never broke on its own.  The day I delivered, my contractions started @ 6:00 in the morning at 10 minutes apart... went to the OB's office to be checked... I was (I believe) around 4 cm dilated and they gave me the option to go home or go to the hospital... I went home until around 6:00 in the afternoon when the contractions finally got to be 3 minutes apart.  The doctor broke my water right before I started pushing... like blueeyedtabbycat said, for me, it was uncomfortable but I really didn't end up feeling much (especially if your deep in labor).  Good luck to you!

I have uterine didelphys, so was considered high risk. When my twins were 38wks, I had a bloody show one morning, called the hospital said I am coming, they said no wait to see how much bleeding or if water breaks, but I told them I am coming in as per dr's instructions at appointment 2 days before. Within half hr, water broke. By the time I was examined, I was 5cm, did not feel a thing till then. ( I was 1.5cm since around 25wks). Got epidural, was I think 7cm then, felt discomfort but no pain from 5cm to 7cm.

i dont really like to tell this story because its so embarrassing...but i guess i will.when i was pregnant with my son at 32 weeks i was at the mall with my mother in law,6 year old sister in law and now,ex husband.we were in the food court during the worst time - noon on christmas eve.i stood up to leave and my water broke everywhere.i mean it splashed all over the floor and i was wearing white so everything became visible.my mom & sister in law were screaming in their british accents and trying to grab at my legs.i thought i was going to die right then and there from sheer embarrassment.everyone in the food court was staring,but i only remember one person - the guy at the next table with his 4 kids trying not to laugh as he handed me a jacket to cover up with.i dont think i said a word to anyone,i just took off to the car with 3 wailing brits behind me.
thanks everyone for sharinglol u poor thing inferior that would have been a bit arkward!!

my water broke on it's own, went to the hospital, was disappointed to only be 2cm, slowly progressed to 4 cm (over a few hours) got an epidural and went from 4 to 10cm during the time it took to put the epidural in, I didn't seem to have to push for long before DD was born.  I was pleasantly surprised at how good I felt after delivery.
thats a nice story keyd, im looking forward to my labour hope it goes smoothly like urs lol!

with ds one I was in the hospital for a month before he was born. I was on bedrest with preeclampsia. With ds2 my water broke at home. THIRTY TWO hours later, I finally gave birth.  yeeesh wasn't that something.

i haden't pee'd in two days and they just kept sending me away. i was in agony, coz i knew i was in labour but coz i couldn't pee baby turned back to back so i had to deliver him like that. Damn doctors wouldn't know a really problem if it hit them in the head, which i actually did. Oops, What they kept touching me without saying

question: I would like to know what the reason was you went into hospital for your labour
title: Did you go in because of contractions or ur waters breaking? POLL PLEASE VOTE
